course.title: React with TypeScript
course.description: Comprehensive guide to building type-safe React applications with TypeScript and React 19

lessons.title: Accessibility Types and ARIA Props
lessons.description: Bake a11y into types—ensure valid ARIA usage and constrain props so inaccessible states can't compile.

lessons.title: Advanced Error Handling Patterns
lessons.description: Build resilient React applications with type-safe error recovery, retry strategies, and fallback patterns

lessons.title: Advanced Type Tricks for React APIs
lessons.description: Pull out the big guns—satisfies, const assertions, conditional and mapped types that make UIs safer and nicer.

lessons.title: Assets and Module Declarations
lessons.description: Teach TypeScript about CSS, images, and SVGs—write module declarations that make imports type-safe.

lessons.title: Traditional approach - does everything
lessons.description: Modern TypeScript build tooling has evolved beyond the "just use tsc for everything" approach. Today's fastest development setups separate type checking from transpilation, using specialized tools for each job. Let's explore how to build...

lessons.title: Building and Development Scripts
lessons.description: Set up essential build and development scripts for React TypeScript projects, including dev servers, builds, testing, and linting.

lessons.title: Code-Splitting and Lazy Types
lessons.description: Split components with React.lazy and keep types intact—ensure default exports, props, and suspense fallbacks match.

lessons.title: Complete Guide to React Component Props with TypeScript
lessons.description: Master typing React props from basics to advanced patterns—required vs optional, defaults, unions, generics, and building self-documenting component APIs.

lessons.title: ComponentType, HOCs, and Render Props
lessons.description: This content has been split into focused guides on HOCs and render props patterns.

lessons.title: Typing Compound Components and Slots
lessons.description: Model parent-child relationships—Menu, Tabs, and List components with typed items and slot props.

lessons.title: Concurrent Features Typing Patterns
lessons.description: Master React 19's concurrent features with TypeScript—transitions, deferred values, and concurrent rendering with type safety.

lessons.title: Typing Context and Selector Patterns
lessons.description: Create fully typed contexts—state/actions split, selectors that minimize re-renders, and ergonomic Provider APIs.

lessons.title: Creating Todos - POST Requests with TypeScript
lessons.description: Build type-safe POST requests with React and TypeScript—handle form submission, optimistic updates, and sync local state with server responses.

lessons.title: Custom Hooks with Generics
lessons.description: Build reusable hooks with proper generic constraints—type-safe data fetching, localStorage, and form management patterns.

lessons.title: Data Fetching and Runtime Validation
lessons.description: Fetch safely—type APIs, validate at runtime, and keep server/client boundaries honest under React 19.

lessons.title: Debugging TypeScript Errors Guide
lessons.description: Master TypeScript error messages in React—decode cryptic errors, fix common issues, and use advanced debugging techniques.

lessons.title: Deleting Todos - DELETE Requests and State Cleanup
lessons.description: Handle DELETE operations with TypeScript—implement soft delete, undo functionality, cascading deletes, and proper state cleanup patterns.

lessons.title: Developer Tools and Type-Driven DX
lessons.description: Use types to supercharge Developer Tools—component labels, prop hints, and action logs that reflect your TypeScript models.

lessons.title: Edge, SSR, and Runtime Types
lessons.description: Target multiple runtimes—align DOM vs Node types, edge constraints, and SSR data contracts with TypeScript.

lessons.title: Edge, SSR, and Hydration Payload Types
lessons.description: Target multiple runtimes—DOM vs Node types, serializable payloads, and safe hydration contracts.

lessons.title: Error Boundaries and Suspense Boundaries
lessons.description: Type error and suspense boundaries—ensure fallback components and error info props are accurately modeled.

lessons.title: Fetching Data with useState and useEffect
lessons.description: Combine useState with useEffect for type-safe data fetching—handle async operations, prevent race conditions, and manage component lifecycle with TypeScript.

lessons.title: flushSync and Imperative DOM with Types
lessons.description: Coordinate with the DOM—type helpers that force sync updates for focus, measurement, and animations sparingly.

lessons.title: Typed Forms, Actions, and useActionState
lessons.description: Model form mutations in React 19—type Actions and useActionState for safe server and client flows.

lessons.title: Forms, Events, and Number Inputs That Don't Lie
lessons.description: Type form handlers once, reuse everywhere—and tame <input type="number"> returning strings.

lessons.title: forwardRef, memo, and displayName with TypeScript
lessons.description: Compose forwardRef and memo without losing types—fix common inference pitfalls and keep good devtools labels.

lessons.title: Full CRUD Todo App - Putting It All Together
lessons.description: Build a production-ready todo application with complete CRUD operations, optimistic updates, error handling, and TypeScript throughout—your complete guide to real-world React development.

lessons.title: Loading States and Error Handling
lessons.description: Master async state patterns with discriminated unions—model loading, success, and error states in TypeScript to make impossible states unrepresentable.

lessons.description: Master React's new compiler with TypeScript—automatic memoization, optimization hints, and type-safe compiler directives.

lessons.description: Use types to encode identity contracts—memo boundaries, readonly data, stable references, and type-safe performance monitoring.
